mdRecord.dcterms:title: Microscope slides in chest
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:medium: wood (plant material); metal; glass (material); paper (fiber product) [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Chest containing 25 small drawers to hold slides and one larger drawer to hold register cards. Several of the slides are dated 4/20/[19]06. Slides contain human, animal, and plant tissues, including bone, carotid artery, eyelid, cervix, diaphragm, eyeball, fallopian tube, hair, kidney, nail, onion, umbilical cord, etc. The box is marked with a Commonwealth of Virginia label.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
Donated by the Department of Cell Biology, UVA [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments or apparatus--Microscopy
